edu.rit.gpu

Class Gpu

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.gpu.Gpu

  • public class Gpu
extends Object
    Class Gpu encapsulates a graphics processing unit (GPU) compute device. A GPU compute device, or just "device", is denoted by an integer device number. To use a device:

    1. Call the gpu() method to get a Gpu object.

    2. Call methods on the Gpu object to perform GPU operations; such as:

    3. Informational operations —
      • ensureComputeCapability()
      • getMultiprocessorCount()

    4. GPU configuration —
      • setCacheConfig(), getCacheConfig()

    5. Create a dynamically allocated primitive array or matrix in GPU memory —
      • getByteArray(), getByteMatrix()
      • getShortArray(), getShortMatrix()
      • getIntArray(), getIntMatrix()
      • getLongArray(), getLongMatrix()
      • getFloatArray(), getFloatMatrix()
      • getDoubleArray(), getDoubleMatrix()

    6. Create a dynamically allocated struct or struct array in GPU memory —
      • getStructVbl()
      • getStructArray()

    7. Get a module containing GPU kernel functions and data —
      • getModule()

    Study the source code of the classes in package edu.rit.pj2.example to see examples of Parallel Java 2 GPU programs.

    Note: Class Gpu is not multiple thread safe. It is assumed that only one thread at a time will call methods on a Gpu object.

    • Method Detail

      • deviceCount

        public static int deviceCount()
        Get the number of GPU devices in the system.
        Returns:
        Number of GPU devices.
        Throws:
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • setDeviceNumbers

        public static void setDeviceNumbers(int[] devnum)
        Specify the GPU device number or numbers this process is allowed to use. If not specified, this process is allowed to use all devices.

        Warning: The setDeviceNumbers() method is intended to be called only by the pj2 launcher program. Do not call the setDeviceNumbers() method yourself.

        Parameters:
        devnum - Array of zero or more device numbers. Each must be in the range 0 through deviceCount()−1. If devnum is null, this process is allowed to use all devices. If devnum is zero length, this process is not allowed to use any devices.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if any device number is out of bounds.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • allowedDeviceCount

        public static int allowedDeviceCount()
        Get the number of GPU devices this process is allowed to use.
        Returns:
        Number of GPU devices.
        Throws:
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • gpu

        public static Gpu gpu()
        Construct a new Gpu object. The next available GPU device is used.
        Returns:
        Gpu object.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if there are no available GPU devices.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • ensureComputeCapability

        public void ensureComputeCapability(int major,
                           int minor)
        Ensure that this Gpu object supports at least the given compute capability. If so, this method merely returns. If not, this method throws a GpuException.
        Parameters:
        major - Required compute capability major version.
        minor - Required compute capability minor version.
        Throws:
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if this Gpu object does not support at least the given compute capability. Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • getMultiprocessorCount

        public int getMultiprocessorCount()
        Get the number of multiprocessors in this GPU.
        Returns:
        Number of multiprocessors.
        Throws:
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • setCacheConfig

        public void setCacheConfig(CacheConfig config)
        Set this GPU's cache configuration. All kernel functions that do not themselves set the cache configuration will use the given cache configuration.
        Parameters:
        config - Cache configuration.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if config is null.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • getCacheConfig

        public CacheConfig getCacheConfig()
        Get this GPU's cache configuration. All kernel functions that do not themselves set the cache configuration will use the returned cache configuration.
        Returns:
        Cache configuration.
        Throws:
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • getByteArray

        public GpuByteArray getByteArray(int len)
        Create a new dynamically allocated GPU byte array. The entire GPU array is mirrored in the CPU. The array elements in CPU memory, namely the item field's elements, are initialized to zeroes. The array elements in GPU memory are not initialized.
        Parameters:
        len - Number of array elements (≥ 1).
        Returns:
        GPU byte array.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if len < 1.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
        See Also:
        getByteArray(int,int)

      • getByteArray

        public GpuByteArray getByteArray(int len,
                        int cpulen)
        Create a new dynamically allocated GPU byte array, of which the given portion is mirrored in the CPU. If cpulen = 0, then none of the array is mirrored in the CPU. The array elements in CPU memory, namely the item field's elements, are initialized to zeroes. The array elements in GPU memory are not initialized.
        Parameters:
        len - Number of array elements (≥ 1).
        cpulen - Number of array elements to mirror in the CPU.
        Returns:
        GPU byte array.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if len < 1, cpulen < 0, or cpulen > len.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
        See Also:
        getByteArray(int)

      • getByteMatrix

        public GpuByteMatrix getByteMatrix(int rows,
                          int cols)
        Create a new dynamically allocated GPU byte matrix. The entire GPU matrix is mirrored in the CPU. The matrix elements in CPU memory, namely the item field's elements, are initialized to zeroes. The matrix elements in GPU memory are not initialized.
        Parameters:
        rows - Number of matrix rows (≥ 1).
        cols - Number of matrix columns (≥ 1).
        Returns:
        GPU byte matrix.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if rows < 1 or cols < 1.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
        See Also:
        getByteMatrix(int,int,int,int)

      • getByteMatrix

        public GpuByteMatrix getByteMatrix(int rows,
                          int cols,
                          int cpurows,
                          int cpucols)
        Create a new dynamically allocated GPU byte matrix, of which the given portion is mirrored in the CPU. If cpurows = 0 or cpucols = 0, then none of the matrix is mirrored in the CPU. The matrix elements in CPU memory, namely the item field's elements, are initialized to zeroes. The matrix elements in GPU memory are not initialized.
        Parameters:
        rows - Number of matrix rows (≥ 1).
        cols - Number of matrix columns (≥ 1).
        cpurows - Number of matrix rows to mirror in the CPU.
        cpucols - Number of matrix columns to mirror in the CPU.
        Returns:
        GPU byte matrix.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if rows < 1, cols < 1, cpurows < 0, cpurows > rows, cpucols < 0, or cpucols > cols.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
        See Also:
        getByteMatrix(int,int)

      • getShortMatrix

        public GpuShortMatrix getShortMatrix(int rows,
                            int cols,
                            int cpurows,
                            int cpucols)
        Create a new dynamically allocated GPU short integer matrix, of which the given portion is mirrored in the CPU. If cpurows = 0 or cpucols = 0, then none of the matrix is mirrored in the CPU. The matrix elements in CPU memory, namely the item field's elements, are initialized to zeroes. The matrix elements in GPU memory are not initialized.
        Parameters:
        rows - Number of matrix rows (≥ 1).
        cols - Number of matrix columns (≥ 1).
        cpurows - Number of matrix rows to mirror in the CPU.
        cpucols - Number of matrix columns to mirror in the CPU.
        Returns:
        GPU short integer matrix.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if rows < 1, cols < 1, cpurows < 0, cpurows > rows, cpucols < 0, or cpucols > cols.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
        See Also:
        getShortMatrix(int,int)

        See Also:
        getDoubleMatrix(int,int)

      • getStructVbl

        public <T extends Struct> GpuStructVbl<T> getStructVbl(Class<T> type)
        Create a new dynamically allocated GPU struct variable. The variable in CPU memory, namely the item field, is initialized to null. The variable in GPU memory is not initialized.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Java data type. Class T must extend class Struct.
        Parameters:
        type - Class object for Java data type.
        Returns:
        GPU struct variable.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if type is null.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • getStructArray

        public <T extends Struct> GpuStructArray<T> getStructArray(Class<T> type,
                                                  int len)
        Create a new dynamically allocated GPU struct array. The entire GPU array is mirrored in the CPU. The array elements in CPU memory, namely the item field's elements, are initialized to null. The array elements in GPU memory are not initialized.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Java data type. Class T must extend class Struct.
        Parameters:
        type - Class object for Java data type.
        len - Number of array elements (≥ 1).
        Returns:
        GPU struct array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if type is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if len < 1.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
        See Also:
        getStructArray(Class,int,int)

      • getStructArray

        public <T extends Struct> GpuStructArray<T> getStructArray(Class<T> type,
                                                  int len,
                                                  int cpulen)
        Create a new dynamically allocated GPU struct array, of which the given portion is mirrored in the CPU. If cpulen = 0, then none of the array is mirrored in the CPU. The array elements in CPU memory, namely the item field's elements, are initialized to null. The array elements in GPU memory are not initialized.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Java data type. Class T must extend class Struct.
        Parameters:
        type - Class object for Java data type.
        len - Number of array elements (≥ 1).
        cpulen - Number of array elements to mirror in the CPU.
        Returns:
        GPU struct array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if type is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if len < 1, cpulen < 0, or cpulen > len.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
        See Also:
        getStructArray(Class,int)

      • getModule

        public Module getModule(String name)
                 throws IOException
        Get a module containing GPU functions and data. The module file is a resource stored in the Java class path.
        Parameters:
        name - Module resource name relative to the Java class path.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

        String version.
